alfredsnippet.snippet:
Jacques Barzun, Science: the glorious entertainment, p.299

"A universal man should approach within himself the universality of all men. Though he cannot take in all possible conclusions, his mind should be open, at least temporarily, to all modes of use, from the analysis of the scientist to the synthesis of the historian, from the art of the poet or musician to the study of primitive man's superstitions, and thence upward to the intuitions of mystics and religious men."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Barzun on the Generalist
